message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Iterator<SoapHeaderElement> responseHeaderElements = message.getSoapHeader().examineAllHeaderElements();
if (responseHeaderElements.hasNext()) {
    SoapHeaderElement header = responseHeaderElements.next();
    String responseCode = header.getAttributeValue(new QName("status"));
    // do something with responseCode
} else {
    // handle case when no ResponseHeader found
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the examineAllHeaderElements() method to get an iterator over all the SOAP header elements in the response. Then, you can use the next() method to get the next header element in the iterator. In this case, you expect to have only one ResponseHeader element, so you can directly access it using the next() method. Finally, you can use the getAttributeValue() method to get the value of the status attribute in the ResponseHeader element.
